page.title: 02Housing
page.content: To the{west}of the reservoir,the housing is a mixture of privately owned and council property.There are several blocks of{12 storey flats.}The houses are mainly{terraced or {semi-detached}and nearly all have gardens.Much of the housing was built between the two world wars. Although there are good transport links with London,many of the people living in the area find employment locally. To the{east}of the reservoir housing is confined to the{Yardley council {estate}built at the end of the 1940's and to strip development along the Sewardstone Road.The village of Sewardstonebury is largely composed of large detached residences close to the local recreation facilities.
